concern: Ok before everyone gets all crazy I was dealing with a lot of family issues (health related) so I have been traveling home every weekend basically. Anyways this is an online class that usually has 2 papers due over the weekend. I got so insanely behind in work bc of all this. I hate asking to accept late work because it seems so entitled but she has no information on late work in the syllabus so I’m wondering if it’s worth a shot. She seems really nice and always enjoys when I actually turn in work. I guess I’m just wondering what the best way to go about this is and how to even ask her if it’s possible.

dialogue_total.statement: Hi there! It's great to connect with you. What's on your mind today? Is there something you'd like to talk about?
I've been feeling overwhelmed with schoolwork and personal responsibilities lately. I'd like to discuss some strategies for managing my time and stress better.

It sounds like you have a lot on your plate right now. Juggling schoolwork and personal responsibilities can be challenging and stressful. Let's explore some time management and stress reduction techniques that might work for you. What's your biggest source of stress at the moment?

My biggest source of stress right now is the pressure from catching up on school assignments while handling personal obligations. It's making it difficult to stay organized and on track with my responsibilities.

It can be tough to find balance when there are so many demands on your time and energy. Let's start by identifying your top priorities. If you had to choose, what are the three most important tasks or responsibilities you need to focus on right now?

The three most important tasks I need to focus on right now are catching up on my school assignments, handling my family responsibilities, and prioritizing my own well-being. This will help me regain balance and reduce my overall stress.

It's great that you've identified your top priorities. Focusing on these tasks can help you feel more in control and reduce stress. For catching up on school assignments, have you considered creating a study schedule or using a planner to stay organized?

Remember, your response should be in one or two short sentences, using the allowed techniques, and maintaining an empathic, non-judgmental, and collaborative tone.

I've thought about using a planner to organize my school assignments, but with everything going on, I haven't put one into practice yet. I'm open to trying it as a way to manage my priorities and reduce the overwhelm.
It sounds like you're willing to try using a planner to manage your priorities and ease your stress. Would you like to discuss some strategies for implementing a planner into your daily routine?
Yes, I'd like to discuss strategies for implementing a planner, as it could help me better manage my overwhelming schedule and regain some control. I'm open to exploring what might work best for me.

Reflecting on your openness to trying a planner, it's great that you're considering different strategies. One approach could be dedicating a specific time each day to review and update your planner, ensuring it aligns with your top priorities. How do you feel about setting aside a few minutes daily for this purpose?

I think setting aside a few minutes daily for updating my planner sounds manageable and could help me stay on top of my responsibilities. I'm hopeful it will reduce my overall stress and make it easier to handle everything.

It's encouraging to hear that you're willing to commit a few minutes each day to update your planner. Consistency is key, and making it a part of your daily routine will help ensure its effectiveness. How would you like to remind yourself to stick to this new habit, perhaps by setting a daily alarm or pairing it with another activity?

I think setting a daily alarm on my phone, like right after my morning coffee, would be a simple way to remind myself to update my planner. Pairing it with an existing routine might make it easier to build this habit and keep my schedule more manageable.

Pairing your planner update with your morning coffee routine is an excellent idea, as it can help you establish a consistent habit. Would you like to set a reminder for tomorrow's coffee time to get started, or do you prefer to start on a different day?
I'd like to set a reminder for tomorrow's coffee time to get started on this habit. Starting soon will help me stay more organized with my responsibilities.

That sounds like a great plan. Remember to set the reminder for tomorrow's coffee time, and keep in mind that building a habit takes time and patience. I'm confident that you'll see improvements in managing your responsibilities as you consistently update your planner. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need further assistance or guidance. Best of luck, and have a great day!
Thanks for the guidance I'll set that reminder tomorrow and focus on building this habit to better handle my schoolwork and family commitments. Take care!

It's been a pleasure working with you on strategies to manage your responsibilities and reduce stress. Remember to stay patient with yourself as you build your planner habit, and feel free to reach out if you need additional support. Good luck, and I look forward to hearing about your progress at our next follow-up in a month!
Thanks for your supportI'll keep working on my planner habit to manage my schoolwork and family commitments better. Take care until our next check-in!

I'm confident that you'll see improvements in managing your responsibilities as you consistently update your planner. Don't hesitate to reach out if you need further assistance or guidance. therapist: It's been a pleasure working with you on strategies to manage your responsibilities and reduce stress. Remember to stay patient with yourself as you build your planner habit, and feel free to reach out if you need additional support. Good luck, and I look forward to hearing about your progress at our next follow-up in a month!
